body.p: Lyon graduated from West Point in 1856 and served as an artillery officer until he resigned his commission on April 30, 1861 to join the Confederate Army. He was captured at Fort Donelson on February 16, 1862 and was exchanged in August. Lyon was eventually promoted to Brigadier General and served in the Department of Western Kentucky. Lyon’s report of his raid mentions that he burned several courthouses, which were being used as barracks by the Union army, and destroyed thousands of dollars worth of supplies.
